digest_items.title: Use environment variables for secrets
digest_items.why: Hardcoded secrets in code are exposed in version control
digest_items.fix: Store secrets in .env files (gitignored) or secret management services

digest_items.title: Scan dependencies for vulnerabilities
digest_items.why: Vulnerable dependencies are a common attack vector in supply chain attacks
digest_items.fix: Use tools like npm audit, pip-audit, or Snyk in your CI/CD pipeline

digest_items.title: Verify backup encryption
digest_items.why: Unencrypted backups are a major data breach risk if storage is compromised
digest_items.fix: Enable encryption at rest and in transit for all backup solutions

digest_items.title: Implement zero trust architecture
digest_items.why: Zero trust assumes breach and verifies every access request
digest_items.fix: Require authentication for all resources regardless of network location

digest_items.title: Scan for exposed secrets in repos
digest_items.why: Committed secrets can be found by attackers scanning public repositories
digest_items.fix: Use tools like git-secrets or truffleHog to scan commit history

digest_items.title: Scan for exposed .git directories
digest_items.why: Exposed .git folders can leak source code and sensitive configuration
digest_items.fix: Block access in web server config or use .htaccess: 'RedirectMatch 404 /\.git'
